topics.body:
You know I think I realized why I don't like *MOST* mecha shows.  I'm going to have massively disagree with Trashboat on this, but the premise of giant mechs in shows when you get down to it is for military purposes.

I think the reason why I don't like mecha that much is that watching them with super powers and what have you is like watching someone retrofit a Abrams tank for playing watergun.

I'm also going to have to disagree with Trash on gundam as well; 08th MS Team and several other iterations had bitching fight scenes.  Most of the iterations focus on military campaigns and the politics of it.  Wing may have had less character development and far too many ruthless killers but the political backstory was better.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d0a6ce6368721a6eed0100#post_53d0a6ce6368721a6eed0100
I have a massive backburner of shows I need to get caught up on, but I actually have a couple of your suggestions on the list.

Side note: finding out a miscellaneous edge while making a 3d model for a high resolution model is a huge pain in the ass.
*click "Is this the extra edge?  No"
*click "Is this the extra edge?  No"
*click "Is this the extra edge?  No"
*click "Is this the extra edge?  No"
*some time later
*click "Is this the extra edge?  Finally!"

The reason why this is such a pain is that if you're creating a animation and a face is wrong then that's going to show up in the animation.  If it's for something without animation that's fine and you can ignore it, but for a character model or such that's a big problem.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
